job_title: Financial Aid Student Worker in Ave Maria, FL
pros: Ave Maria University has a great culture and work environment. I got along with all of my coworkers and supervisors, and, even though I was only a student worker, I was highly respected and valued by the team in Financial Aid and Admissions. When I was scheduled to work but didn't have any projects to do, my supervisor would allow me to do homework. Very helpful, for a full-time college student.
cons: At minimum wage, the pay wasn't great. It was only a student work position though, so I wasn't expecting more.

job_title: Student Tutor in Ave Maria, FL

review_title: Good place to work, but some drawbacks
job_title: Assistant Director of Audio Visual in Ave Maria, FL
pros: The students are the primary reason I work here. I serve them by providing the means to enjoy wholesome entertainment in keeping with the Catholic Mission of the university.y supervisors are fantastic and supportive, making sure I'm handling my responsibilities and have most of the resources I need to do my job.
cons:
Budgets are tight, which makes getting every resource necessary a challenge. Student workers can be somewhat immature, with an overly idealistic view of how things should work when it comes to handling tasks that pop up unscheduled. Communication is the ever-present con at this place. Silo effect is rampant, which can mean that things that need A/V support sometimes get missed, or events get cancelled without notice.
Every job title denotes a narrower field of responsibility than each employee actually bears. It's tough to maintain good work-life balance when your responsibilities keep you at work much later than normal. Also, keep in mind that people accept a job based on what the job description is, and often don't like to have things added which don't pertain to that job description at all.

job_title: Student Ambassador in Ave Maria, FL
pros: Everyone who works here is very kind. My boss never got mad at me when I didn't understand how to do something. It is a very good enviornment
cons: For student workers, they only pay minimum wage. It makes sense, as we are just part-time student workers, but a little higher pay would be nice.

review_title: Overall good, but many missed opportunities to be an excellent employer
job_title: Student Support in Ave Maria, FL
pros:
Wonderful colleagues and students, the opportunity to work at an institution that has a clearly defined Catholic mission that isn't watered down like most schools, location, some opportunity for growth for self starters

President Ice shows a lot of promise in terms of improving what's broken with student and employee culture.
cons: Low pay, high employee turnover, a board of trustees that make questionable decisions and have no appreciation for faculty and staff, everyone is overworked, departments are taken in different directions every year or two.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Ave Maria, FL
pros: Students are great and a joy to work with.
cons: Far from Naples and Bonita Springs.

job_title: Student Worker in Ave Maria, FL
pros: Flexible schedule, and nice atmosphere
cons: payed on a monthly basis

job_title: Associate Professor in Ave Maria, FL
pros: Ave Maria University is a truly Catholic institution. The faculty care about students, care about the mission.
cons: The marketing department often fails to represent what we are really about. When I say "we," I suppose I am primarily talking about the faculty. We are not a "resort-like location," we are place where hearts, intellects continue to be formed to recognize and respond to Beauty, Truth, and Goodness. There is some disorganization, policies in flux, that would be better hidden at a larger, more established institution. For me, being able to teach at a truly Catholic university outweighs these things, but it can still be frustrating. Housing can be a challenge, especially for single income households. Ask about Middlebrooke housing if this is a concern.

pros:

A very safe place to work and live.

cons:

Low pay.
You're often doing work outside of your job description, and unable to get your own work done unless you work after hours or come in early.

job_title: Graduate Assistant Football Coach in Ave Maria, FL
pros: The athletic department is well organized under the new athletic director, Joe Patterson, and he continues to grow in his role every day. He advocates for the athletic department well and makes good hires for each of the sports to establish great cultures.
cons: The facilities are still in its infancy, and strides have been made for the administration to support athletics. However, more progress is needed so athletes and coaches can feel completely accepted and heard in the community.

cons: Ave Maria offers limited pay to entry-level workers.

job_title: Audio/Visual Technician in Ave Maria, FL
pros: Great mission of evangelization through education and service. This view originates at the highest levels of the administration and carries down through the whole school. The supervisors are good and care about their employees. Not stuffy, but good performance is expected. Good supervisors help guide employees who might be a little lost.
cons: Communication isn't the university's strongest suit. Work-life balance depends on your role in the organization and how involved that role requires you to be. Also, don't expect an amazing salary. The mission comes first.

review_title: My overall experience with the University was great.
job_title: Assistant Football Coach in Ave Maria, FL
pros: My position offered free housing in a 3 bedroom 2 bath condo.  Condo was in good shape and I lived with other coaches.  My position also included a free meal plan at the student cafeteria.
cons: Sometimes paycheck would arrive several days late which could put someone in a bind if they needed the money on the day it was expected.  Also it sometimes took over a month to receive reimbursement checks on expenses you paid for ok behalf of university.

review_title: Athletic Dept is very motivated to succeed.
